title: Hunter

source.file: docs/sources/phb2024/05-Character Classes (Continued) - Players Handbook - Dungeons & Dragons - Sources - D&D Beyond.pdf

feature_defs.trigger: while a creature is marked by your hunter's mark
effects: You know whether the creature has any immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities, and if so, what they are.
Colossus Slayer: once per turn when you hit with a weapon, deal +1d8 damage if the target is missing any hit points.

Horde Breaker: once on each of your turns when you attack with a weapon, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature within 5 feet of the original target, within the weapon's range, and not already attacked by you this turn.
limits: When you finish a short or long rest, you can replace the chosen option with the other one.

effects: Escape the Horde: opportunity attacks have disadvantage against you.
Multiattack Defense: when a creature hits you with an attack roll, that creature has disadvantage on all other attack rolls against you this turn.
limits: When you finish a short or long rest, you can replace the chosen option with the other one.

effects: Once per turn when you deal Hunter's Mark extra damage to a marked creature, you can also deal that extra damage to a different creature you can see within 30 feet of the first.
You gain resistance to that damage and any other damage of the same type until the end of the current turn.

notes: Normalized for subclass scope and concise clauses.
